title: The fortunes of the Falconars /
author: Gordon
snippet: Mrs. Moray had established herself in a small house in Stafford Street, where her recent widoAv- hood compelled her to live in great retirement. Her daughter was frequently a guest in Mrs. Peter Balmayne's house; and thence poor Grace contemplated, at awe-struck distance, the glories of her cousin Matilda ; and with a mixture of gratified vanity in being connected with such a divinity, and of repining at the partialities of fortune, listened to Mrs. Balmayne's splendid description of the balls where Matilda had been, the partners and admirers who thronged around her, and the enthusiastic praise universally uttered of her wit, her talents, her singing, her painting, her riding, her dancing, &c.
